meaningMnemonic: The <kanji>thing</kanji>s you <kanji>wear</kanji> are your <vocabulary>clothes</vocabulary>. Oh, and Japanese clothes count too. We're talking <vocabulary>kimono</vocabulary>s. Way back when, these could just be called <vocabulary>clothes</vocabulary> because it's all people really wore, but nowadays we know they're specific to the stereotypical kimono you think of when you think "Japan."
readingMnemonic: The reading is a bit strange using kun'yomi readings. Luckily, we taught you these already, so go put on that kimono of yours and relax at the 温泉 for a bit.
